modules.description: This module defines the core data types used to represent users, teams, and notes when interacting with the HackMD API. It includes structured types for user and team metadata, note summaries, and full note details, along with permission enums for access control. These types are used directly in API requests and responses to ensure correct serialization and deserialization of data.

This module provides client-side operations for interacting with the HackMD API v1, enabling user authentication, note management, and team collaboration. It defines core data types such as users, teams, note summaries, and full note details, along with permission enums for access control, used directly in API requests and responses. Operations include fetching a user's note list, creating a note in a team workspace, and deleting a note by ID. The module combines these direct APIs with structured data handling to support both personal and team-based note interactions.

This module provides client-side operations for interacting with the HackMD API v1, enabling user authentication, note management, and team collaboration. It defines core data types such as users, teams, note summaries, and full note details, along with permission enums for access control. Operations include fetching a user's note list, creating a note in a team workspace, and deleting a note by ID. For example, you can retrieve all notes for a user, create a shared note within a team, or delete an existing note using its identifier.
